metadata.synopsis: JLatino: This is where creatures of the night: illithid player, emperor, and Astarion states are dealt with.Could likely start on the docks, would be nice to start them walking back to the warehouse area at Trunk Point to get a staging change into the scene.EXITS:END_BrainBattle_CombatOver_Nested_ConclusionTerminus

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *You could stay, and help. Your considerable strengths would not be unwelcome in such an endeavour...*

225.speaker: Narrator
225.text: *At least you would not be alone... as long as Karlach, despite her change, stays Karlach.*

139.speaker: Narrator
139.text: *At least you would not be alone... if only Karlach's heart were healed.*

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *At least you would not be alone... if only you knew where Karlach was.*
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player notices Karlach is gone. InternalNodeContext: Go to: END_GameFinale_DeathOfKarlach

206.speaker: Lae'zel
206.text: We honour the fallen. Starting with Gale.
206.context: NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

164.speaker: Shadowheart
164.text: We raise a glass to Gale. Perhaps the Elfsong still stands?
164.context: NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

133.speaker: Astarion
133.text: I suppose we'd better honour Gale - perhaps there's a library somewhere that has a bar and a room full of virgins.
133.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

145.speaker: Astarion
145.text: I suppose we'd better honour Gale, - perhaps there's a library somewhere that has a bar...
145.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

233.speaker: Wyll
233.text: We honour Gale. A plaque perhaps, or better yet a statue.
233.context: NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

135.speaker: Halsin
135.text: We should honour the wizard's sacrifice. I shall plant a forest in his name.
135.context: NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

24.speaker: Jaheira
24.text: We can spare more than a moment for Gale. And more than one drink.
24.context: NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

70.speaker: Minsc
70.text: We will drink for Gale. Boo and I are banned from most of the inns in the city, but you may order for us.
70.context: NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

180.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
180.text: We should claim whatever's left of the Elfsong as spoils, and drink it dry. We will raise the first glass to our memories of Gale.
180.context: NodeContext: Gale exploded himself and the brain to save the world

198.speaker: Narrator
198.text: *Rest, rejoice, and remember Gale - the wizard who sacrificed himself to save the world.*

1.speaker: Player
1.text: A quick rest, and then - to work. There's a lot of good a mind flayer could do in this world, and I intend to do it.

179.speaker: Lae'zel
179.text: Then let us hope your intentions remain as they are and do not undergo any further corruption.

71.speaker: Shadowheart
71.text: We've certainly benefited from your gifts. It stands to reason that others may do so also.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: How wonderful, but do try not to limit yourself. You've just saved the world, now is not the time to become boring.

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: Just remember who your friends are, will you? In case you start to become... well, you know, hungry.

11.speaker: Wyll
11.text: It seems you've found peace with yourself - I'm glad. Just as long as your intentions remain as pure as they are now.

41.speaker: Gale
41.text: Your intellect will be valuable indeed. So long as it remains uncorrupted.

19.speaker: Halsin
19.text: I can't pretend to understand your ambitions, or what drives them, but I wish you well.

36.speaker: Jaheira
36.text: Were it any other mind flayer, I would put an end to this right now. But - I suppose you have earned the benefit of the doubt.

203.speaker: Minsc
203.text: Boo thinks you are very wise. He only wishes to remind you that his brain - while vast - would not make much of a meal.

87.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
87.text: As long as you have no designs on my mind, I do not much care what your intentions are.
87.context: NodeContext: emphasis on 'what' - dismissing a former ally who has become a mind flayer and claims to have 'good' intentions

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I'll stay in the city. The world could use a mind flayer with good intentions. And a mind flayer's intellect.

97.speaker: The Emperor
97.text: It's true. Whatever benefits one illithid could bring will only be doubled when there are two.

259.speaker: Player
259.text: I'm a mind flayer. I'll do whatever I please.

173.speaker: Lae'zel
173.text: Fine. But do not let your guard down, even for a moment. Any hunter worth their blade seeks an illithid head as a trophy.

83.speaker: Wyll
83.text: I can't guarantee you a warm welcome in the city, but should you find me, you'll have a seat at my table.

38.speaker: Wyll
38.text: Then we'll both be carving our own paths. I wish you well in yours.

10.speaker: Gale
10.text: And so long as it doesn't please you to munch on my cerebellum, I'll be right behind you.

90.speaker: Halsin
90.text: Easier said than done, I fear. You may find yourself welcome in some circles... but set upon in far more.

47.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
47.text: As you should, you have earned the right.

16.speaker: Shadowheart
16.text: As long as it's still you in there, and you haven't completely lost your mind.

254.speaker: Astarion
254.text: By all means, go and live however you wish. As long as we don't get in each other's way, I'm sure all will be well.
254.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Mind Flayer Player just said "I'm a mind flayer, I'm gonna go do whatever I want"

266.speaker: Astarion
266.text: At this point, you've earned it. Just don't start any grand designs, and I'm sure we'll all stay friends.
266.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Mind Flayer Player just said "I'm a mind flayer, I'm gonna go do whatever I want"

221.speaker: Jaheira
221.text: And so long as they remain your wants, and not those of any hivemind - I wish you well.
221.context: NodeContext: Considering. She should object to this, but it's not a terrible idea.

249.speaker: Minsc
249.text: Minsc and Boo will be keeping many eyes on you. For friendship, of course - and to be sure you sup only on sinful brains.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: I think it's best I find somewhere to go into hiding.

132.speaker: The Emperor
132.text: A wise decision. You will not be welcome here, no matter what miracles you perform.

115.speaker: Lae'zel
115.text: Far from the fate you deserve for the sacrifices you have made, but... I understand.

119.speaker: Shadowheart
119.text: A poor reward, considering the sacrifices you made. But I understand. May Lady Shar bless you.
119.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH remained loyal to Shar

57.speaker: Shadowheart
57.text: A poor reward, considering the sacrifices you made. But I understand.

236.speaker: Astarion
236.text: It's not so bad in the dark. Only about half of the Baldurian sewers are active.

75.speaker: Astarion
75.text: You are braver than I could ever dream to be. I hope we will meet again, on a cloudy night.

270.speaker: Wyll
270.text: It's unfair. All you've done for me, for the Sword Coast - only to be forced into the dark. I'll miss you dearly.

27.speaker: Gale
27.text: It's far from the fate you deserve for the scale of your sacrifice, but I understand why you feel the need to do it.

252.speaker: Halsin
252.text: You deserve so much better, but alas... I understand. Do as you must.

32.speaker: Jaheira
32.text: To hide your face from the city you saved. You see now why this hero's business is not all story and song.
32.context: NodeContext: Grimly sad for us - but she thinks we'll understand her general begrudgery about being called a 'hero' now.

213.speaker: Minsc
213.text: It is an injustice, that those you saved will not see the goodness behind an evil face. But Boo and I - we will visit!
213.context: NodeContext: First part said darkly, displeased at the ingratitude Baldurians would show the player in mind flayer form. Second part bright and excited

131.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
131.text: I fear you must. These people are too short-sighted to recognise a saviour in an unfamiliar form.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Let's get out of this city. The Underdark calls to me...

153.speaker: Lae'zel
153.text: The Underdark has its violent charms. I might just pay you a visit once you're settled.

112.speaker: The Emperor
112.text: It's not for everyone, but it is a wise choice for you.

166.speaker: The Emperor
166.text: You have much to learn about yourself in your new form, and the Underdark will prove a fitting nursery.

211.speaker: Narrator
211.text: *There was always going to be a moment when your sacrifice caught up with you. A threshold beyond which you would have to venture alone. This is that moment.*

199.speaker: Narrator
199.text: *You are a mind flayer, after all. You will have the rest of your long years ahead to understand what that means.*

210.speaker: Narrator
210.text: *Meanwhile your allies have rather inferior plans of their own.*

29.speaker: Shadowheart
29.text: The Underdark? As much as I appreciate its shadows, I think Lady Shar will have use for me elsewhere...
29.context: NodeContext: Unconvinced. (Arc: SH remained loyal to Shar)

271.speaker: Shadowheart
271.text: The Underdark? I've had my fill of lurking in the shadows, if it's all the same.

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: The Underdark? You poor thing. I have a palace, you can sleep on one of a hundred couches until you're on your feet.

182.speaker: Astarion
182.text: The Underdark? Now that's a thought. Just not to the Drow - they don't treat pretty boys too kindly. Or any boys at all, really.

169.speaker: Astarion
169.text: The Underdark is a popular option. Just try to avoid the vampire spawn - I can't promise they'll be as friendly as yours truly.
169.context: NodeContext: [Good path Astarion] Mind Flayer Avatar says they'll go live in the Underdark, where the party released a whole load of Vampire Spawn

107.speaker: Wyll
107.text: Answer it, then - but you'll be going without me. I'm sorry.

96.speaker: Gale
96.text: The Underdark? Not exactly on the top of my list, but I think I understand why the idea appeals to you.

49.speaker: Halsin
49.text: The Underdark? All part of nature's creation, of course, but perhaps not its most hospitable corner, after all we've been through...

129.speaker: Jaheira
129.text: Then you must answer. But far more deadly terrain awaits me here. Home.
129.context: NodeContext: not liking the idea to go the underdark

134.speaker: Minsc
134.text: I am not sure it is a call that Boo can answer.

187.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
187.text: It calls to me too, but I can never return. I have executed enough heretics in my time to know what horrors await an exile from Lolth.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I think a celebration is in order.

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.text: A wise choice, ra'stil, perhaps the wisest you've ever made.

235.speaker: Shadowheart
235.text: Let's not forget the wine - I want to flush out my brain, just to be completely sure the tadpole's gone.

245.speaker: Shadowheart
245.text: A celebration, yes. And perhaps a drink, too.

227.speaker: Astarion
227.text: Yes! We should see if the Elfsong's still standing. It's been so long since I've had a fine wine. And we have more than earned it.

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: Yes! We should see if the Elfsong's still standing. I won't imbibe, but I'll be happy to be away from here, and in your company.

113.speaker: Wyll
113.text: Excellent. Let's see if the Elfsong's still standing. Their Golden Sands Brew goes down real easy.

238.speaker: Gale
238.text: We should drink. Perhaps there's an inn still standing. Every drop will be well-deserved.

37.speaker: Halsin
37.text: Very well. Perhaps after a drink or five I'll be tempted to inflict some of my singing on you all - as if the city has not suffered enough.

234.speaker: Jaheira
234.text: There is much to do, but... a drink might be nice. A seat would be better.

76.speaker: Minsc
76.text: Heroically spoken! We must find an inn. Minsc has been banned from his share of ale-halls, but I am sure you and Boo can speak for me.

219.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
219.text: I agree. We should claim whatever's left of the Elfsong as spoils, and drink it dry. By rights, half the city belongs to us.

25.speaker: Karlach
25.text: I wouldn't mind a very well-earned libation, myself.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: We should stay in the city. Help to rebuild it.

137.speaker: Lae'zel
137.text: I much prefer bloodletting to bricklaying. Hunt prey with me by night, and I will build with you by day.

144.speaker: The Emperor
144.text: I will not be joining you. I fear my presence will be no more welcome in the streets of the city than it ever was.

175.speaker: Lae'zel
175.text: Every ghaik is an abomination. Maybe you're an exception. Maybe.

205.speaker: Narrator
205.text: *Now that you no longer live in each other's minds, it's hard to tell if the mind flayer is being sincere.*

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *Though perhaps no harder than it ever was.*
46.context: InternalNodeContext: Loads of banches converge to this point

69.speaker: Astarion
69.text: I honestly don't mind what we do, once we get - ow!
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Flinches, as if a bug bit him on the hand. The sun is starting to burn him, although Astarion doesn't realise yetNodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Full line: "once we get off this beach"

94.speaker: Astarion
94.text: What the - oh no. Oh gods.
94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at his hand, which is starting to smoke. Realises his time in the sun is up.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Realising your time in the sun is up. Sad, sullen

261.speaker: Astarion
261.text: Well... it was nice while it lasted.
261.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still looking at his handNodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] resigned, you're losing the greatest gift you've ever had. Also a little in pain.

99.speaker: Astarion
99.text: Argh! I'm sorry, I - I have to go!
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: now that the tadpole's gone, Astarion has started to burn in the sunNodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Without the tadpole's protection the sun is really starting to burn, you have to run for shade before it becomes too much

258.speaker: Lae'zel
258.text: Call him man or call him monster, but Astarion was a force against the Grand Design. He deserves to bask in the sun, not to hide in darkness.
258.context: InternalNodeContext: A few banches converge to this point

33.speaker: Shadowheart
33.text: Poor Astarion. How he loved the sun - if only the feeling was mutual. I hope that isn't the last we see of him.
33.context: NodeContext: Sympathetic (ally can no longer walk in sunlight)

110.speaker: Wyll
110.text: Astarion! Gods, what a horror, to feel the sun on your skin for so long, only to be forced back into the shadows.
110.context: NodeContext: Sympathetic, horrified (ally can no longer walk in sunlight)

267.speaker: Gale
267.text: Astarion! Cured of one affliction, only to be reclaimed by another. The sun is no longer a friend to him, but we must be - he'll need more solace than shadows can provide.
267.context: NodeContext: Calling out to him, then speaking to those nearby. Pitying, but determined to help

42.speaker: Halsin
42.text: A cruel blow - Astarion loved feeling the caress of the sun... only now it gouges him with its claws. Perhaps we shall meet again, beneath a shield of darkness.
42.context: NodeContext: sympathetic/referring to Astarion after he's fled from the sun

77.speaker: Jaheira
77.text: Be well, Astarion. Hide while you must - but do not think your city is done with you just yet.
77.context: NodeContext: Quietly to herself - to Astarion's retreating back as he flees the sunlight

80.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
80.text: Astarion is cursed to flee the sun as I am cursed to walk in it. Do not belittle him with pity - he is a survivor, and will thrive upon what bounty the darkness provides. There is life in him yet.
80.context: NodeContext: Hint of pity, but she thinks Astarion got the better side of the deal. She's confident he'll be okay.

18.speaker: Karlach
18.text: Astarion. Burnt by the sun again. Godsdamn, that's fucking cruel.

148.speaker: Narrator
148.text: *Astarion never let the darkness swallow you. You know that although he heads to the shadow, together, both your souls are all the lighter.*

260.speaker: Narrator
260.text: *Astarion chased away your moments of darkness. You have no doubt that after all you've fought together, you will find him again.*

239.speaker: Narrator
239.text: *Darkness once more swallows Astarion - but you will find him again, as you always do.*

191.speaker: Narrator
191.text: *Darkness once more swallows Astarion. Without Cazador's lurking presence, perhaps he will find comfort there now.*

226.speaker: Narrator
226.text: *Darkness once more swallows Astarion - with the lurking grasp of Cazador still reaching towards him.*

189.speaker: Lae'zel
189.text: That's the last of Astarion the sun will ever see. May he fare well in the dark.
189.context: InternalNodeContext: A few banches converge to this point

269.speaker: Shadowheart
269.text: It seems that's the end of Astarion's love affair with the sun. That'll be hard on him...
269.context: NodeContext: Sympathetic (ally can no longer walk in sunlight)

248.speaker: Wyll
248.text: Astarion will keep to the dark now, I wager. At least... he'll find plenty to feast on.

48.speaker: Gale
48.text: I suppose that's the last time any of us will see him, and the last time he'll ever see the sun.

161.speaker: Halsin
161.text: He will sorely miss that freedom, I sense. It may be quite some time before we see him again.

222.speaker: Jaheira
222.text: I doubt we'll ever see that face basking in the sun again.
222.context: NodeContext: Referrring to Astarion running from the sunlight, his immunity gone

156.speaker: Minsc
156.text: We will find you, Astarion! AND BOO WILL BRING A SUNFLOWER!
156.context: NodeContext: Calling out after Astarion, trying to comfort him after he's had to flee the sun - he lost his immunity for a noble act

241.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
241.text: I almost envy him. While he retreats into shadow, I prepare for my long exile on the surface.

159.speaker: Karlach
159.text: Back to the shadows. But perhaps not forever. Even though worst affliction can be fixed - with some amount of sacrifice.

162.speaker: Narrator
162.text: *Astarion's days in the sun are behind him. The best you can hope is that he finds darkness, and the comfort it once gave him.*

176.speaker: Narrator
176.text: *Knowing him, he probably will. Comfort was always one of his specialties. Especially when it was his own.*

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *You feel a gentle tingling on your skin - a faint prickle that starts to spread across any exposed flesh.*
4.context: NodeContext: Player Astarion starts to burn in the sun

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: Astarion - the sun's already begun to take its toll on you. Truly, I am sorry.

39.speaker: Shadowheart
39.text: It looks like basking in the sun is no longer an option for you, Astarion. You'd better find some shade.
39.context: NodeContext: Sympathetic (ally can no longer walk in sunlight)

82.speaker: Wyll
82.text: Hells - Astarion. The sun's already begun to scorch you.

130.speaker: Halsin
130.text: The sun is no longer your friend, then. A freedom you shall sorely miss, I feel.

34.speaker: Jaheira
34.text: You'd best seek shelter, Astarion, and quickly. The world owes you - but the sun feels no such debt.
34.context: NodeContext: Referrring to Astarion beginning to burn in the sun now he gave up his immunity. Gentle, but urgent - he gave up a lot, and it's not fair.

58.speaker: Minsc
58.text: Astarion...? Boo says you are beginning to smell like a festival-day feast...
58.context: NodeContext: Note of gentle, friendly warning - Astarion is starting to smoke in the sun

190.speaker: Gale
190.text: Now, without wishing to cause undue alarm, might I suggest we find some shade? I think the sun is reneging on that truce of yours.

200.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
200.text: You are beginning to blister, spawn. Best scurry back to the shadows.

126.speaker: Karlach
126.text: You're burning up, soldier. Take cover!

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *Your days in the sun are behind you. The best you can hope for is that you find darkness, and the comfort it once gave you.*

152.speaker: Lae'zel
152.text: Now - all of Toril, spread before me. A million marks to make, a million battles to fight.

102.speaker: Lae'zel
102.text: I may not belong to this land, but now, it belongs to me.

73.speaker: Shadowheart
73.text: A lot of people died so we could get to this moment.

147.speaker: Shadowheart
147.text: Let's go find somewhere to offer them a toast.

265.speaker: Astarion
265.text: Although I suppose there is a lot to do here - power to consolidate, a palace to claim. It will take time.

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: But first, you and I are going to find the most hedonistic establishment in this city, and we are going to have a night that will go down in legend.

251.speaker: Astarion
251.text: After everything, I think I've earned it.

7.speaker: Wyll
7.text: Lest we forget - there are still graves to dig, injured to thank, warriors to exalt.

21.speaker: Wyll
21.text: They carved our course. Honour them with each and every step you take.

3.speaker: Gale
3.text: There are many heroes' graves that will need to be dug. Many eulogies to be written.

178.speaker: Gale
178.text: Let's honour them each and all - but preferably with a drink in hand.

157.speaker: Halsin
157.text: Many died so that we could see this day. They deserve to be honoured.

84.speaker: Halsin
84.text: But first, we revel and rest.

195.speaker: Jaheira
195.text: Whatever the next step, the path will still be there come morn. There is no harm in taking a moment to honour the fallen. Then, quite honestly - to sleep.

183.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
183.text: So many have fallen, on both sides of this conflict. Once, I would have died proudly in defence of the Netherbrain, thinking it a god.

264.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
264.text: It is a sobering thought, and I intend to chase it away with whatever filth passes for wine in these parts.

66.speaker: Minsc
66.text: There are fallen to honour, as well. So many that we may never learn all of their names - but that is no reason not to try.

237.speaker: Karlach
237.text: Whatever our next step, we each have our own path to forge. Mine stranger than I ever believed possible - and yet, possible.
237.context: NodeContext: Reflecting on how weird it is to be a mind flayer - yet glad she's alive at all.

22.speaker: Shadowheart
22.text: I never thought I'd be sorry to see a mind flayer go, yet here we are. Be safe.
22.context: NodeContext: Bidding farewell (Arc: SH rejected Shar)

68.speaker: Shadowheart
68.text: I never thought I'd be sorry to see a mind flayer go, yet here we are. Lady Shar be with you.
68.context: NodeContext: Bidding farewell (Arc: SH is loyal to Shar)

52.speaker: Astarion
52.text: Walk safely into the dark. You were truly tentacular.

209.speaker: Astarion
209.text: I hope the nights and shadows treat you well. You're an odd friend. But, I suppose, a friend still.

44.speaker: Wyll
44.text: I can't believe I'm about to say this, but - part of me will miss you.

257.speaker: Gale
257.text: You're right of course. But, well... I'll miss you, friend. Your companionship has been quite the education.

64.speaker: Halsin
64.text: I could scarcely have imagined a mind flayer as an ally or a friend once... but I shall miss you.

263.speaker: Jaheira
263.text: We were never bosom friends, illithid - but I owe you a debt. Be well.
263.context: NodeContext: Grudging respect for a monstrous illithid who helped save us all

160.speaker: Minsc
160.text: No, Boo, I will not miss the illithid. That is but manful sweat in my eye!
160.context: NodeContext: Defensively hissed to Boo as the Emperor bids it final farewell.

6.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
6.text: If Baldur's Gate is too foolish to recognise its saviours, so be it. The city will miss your influence, as will I.

98.speaker: Karlach
98.text: I hope you are wrong, my friend.

181.speaker: Shadowheart
181.text: Yes. The city must be rebuilt. Lady Shar's church needs fertile ground in which to flourish... and in the meanwhile, there will be plenty of lost souls drawn to her embrace...

124.speaker: Shadowheart
124.text: Not just the city - imagine the swathe of destruction the Absolute's armies will have caused.

60.speaker: Astarion
60.text: You're joking. After everything we've been through, you expect me to do manual labour?

207.speaker: Astarion
207.text: After everything, that's your suggestion? Aren't you tired? I'm tired.

125.speaker: Wyll
125.text: Yes. Baldur's Gate will rise ever stronger. Let us be the ones to lay the first bricks.

128.speaker: Gale
128.text: Perhaps we can circle back to that one, once the fires have died and the rubble's settled. I do think we deserve a little rest.

151.speaker: Halsin
151.text: Perhaps. But I fear it would take an entirely fresh start to mend the ills of this place...

197.speaker: Jaheira
197.text: I'll wager I can find a few helping hands. My children have not grown too old for chores.

154.speaker: Minsc
154.text: Minsc has flattened parts of the city before. The masons, they seem to prefer he stand and watch.

208.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
208.text: Why bother? Let Baldur's Gate wear its scars proudly, until the next crisis wipes it from the world entirely.

220.speaker: Karlach
220.text: I may not be as strong as I used to be, but I'll be much better at advising the project.

250.speaker: Player
250.text: Let's get out of this godsforsaken city. I hear Amn is lovely this time of year.

61.speaker: Lae'zel
61.text: Amn? A keen idea - I was taught its Cloud Peaks are infested with monsters of all sorts. But first, fresh meat and a hot fire.

192.speaker: The Emperor
192.text: Then this is where we part ways. I have business to attend to here. And a life to rebuild.

127.speaker: Shadowheart
127.text: My destiny lies in this city, with Lady Shar's church. They look to me now.

218.speaker: Shadowheart
218.text: What's the rush? Surely we're due to be feted as heroes in this place. We'll drink for free if any taverns survived.

184.speaker: Astarion
184.text: Why stop at Amn? There's a whole world out there - we just have to take it.

201.speaker: Astarion
201.text: It would be good to travel. It's been so long, kidnappings aside.

216.speaker: Wyll
216.text: Baldur's Gate burns, and its people tremble. I can't yet turn my back - not while the city's wounds still bleed.

168.speaker: Gale
168.text: Truly? I don't know how you could even contemplate taking to the road after the journey we've been on.

253.speaker: Halsin
253.text: I assume you will not be surprised to learn I long to escape the city. I miss silence, greenery...

136.speaker: Jaheira
136.text: Last time I was there, I was poisoned near to death. Still, a little more restful than this place.
136.context: NodeContext: Appraising our idea to go to Amn

146.speaker: Minsc
146.text: That city is a sizzling boil of corruption, with fiends 'round every corner. Boo cannot wait!
146.context: NodeContext: Starts out glowering, but ends actually excited about returning to the action.

106.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
106.text: Why leave? Baldur's Gate will be desperate for new leadership, and who better than us to lend our assistance.

78.speaker: Karlach
78.text: I wouldn't mind paying Amn a visit. Never been that far south, myself.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: I think it's time we part ways.

23.speaker: Shadowheart
23.text: I suppose our band wasn't meant to last forever... fate thrust us together, now it pulls us apart again.

231.speaker: Lae'zel
231.text: I have fought many great battles by your side - I long for many more. I hope you reconsider.

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: True, we have served our respective purposes. We're free to go wherever we wish.

256.speaker: Astarion
256.text: Oh, you can't mean that. After all this?
256.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Reaction to suggestion of the party going its seperate ways

86.speaker: Wyll
86.text: Is this our final parting then? Please, reconsider. Alone, you are a storm. But together, we are a tempest.

20.speaker: Gale
20.text: I won't lie. I'll miss our group. Hells, I'll even miss sleeping rough in the wilderness, to an extent.

262.speaker: Halsin
262.text: It was always destined to be so, if we prevailed. But the foreknowledge makes it no less bittersweet...

63.speaker: Jaheira
63.text: For a time, at least. Time has taught me not to traffic in farewells - they are rarely so final as you might think.
63.context: NodeContext: Shrugging at player suggesting party go their separate ways, knowing smile. (Yes, very on the nose about a returning canon character)

255.speaker: Minsc
255.text: You would be parted from Boo so soon? Before he has even given his victory speech?
255.context: NodeContext: Reacting to player suggesting parting ways after defeating the Brain

56.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
56.text: I had hoped we would not part so quickly. I have no home, and few friends remaining in this world.

223.speaker: Karlach
223.text: So soon? How strange. I thought our bond was... I don't know. Formidable.
